posts.description: I am working on an application that does some analysis on different sets of tweets. We are collecting the tweets from Gnip using Apache Flume and the tweets are saved into two destinations (Apache Solr, Elasticsearch). posts.message: Any recommendations for a good email client for windows

Hola Geeks,
I need your advice, more like guidance or experience.
I'm currently on the track for a Bachelor's degree in software engineering but I suck at software design and architecture.
Every time I'm designing a software I don't really know what to do to best design it, I know some design patterns and practices but It's never enough, what would you advice? What would be a good exercise or a project to learn from? Any valuable resources you know of?
Thanks.
A nice presentation on the increasing interest in single purpose computing for server applications, nicely tying this to containers and potentially on to unikernel based systems.

posts.caption: codecademy.com
posts.description: Learn how to control your computer with the command line. By the end of the course, you'll be able to use the power of the command line to manipulate data and automate tasks.
